title: Victim, suspect identified in alleged accidental shooting
content:
AUSTIN - One person is in custody after allegedly shooting his friend on accident early Monday morning at a South Austin apartment complex.
Police said they were called to 501 East Stassney Lane around 1:10 a.m. Monday for a reported accidental shooting. The address corresponds to the Austin City Lights apartment complex.
The caller told officers that he and his friend were taking pictures with a loaded gun when he accidentally shot his friend.
Responding officers found the victim, identified as 24-year-old Aaron Moore, on the floor in the apartment. He was dead at the scene.
The caller, 24-year-old Fischer Hoisington, told officers they were celebrating his and Moore's birthdays, both December 12, and had been drinking beer and wine. They were posing with a handgun, aiming the gun at each other for pictures, when Fischer accidentally pulled the trigger and shot Moore. Fischer said he was not aware that Moore had loaded the gun before he picked it up.
Fischer was charged with Manslaughter for recklessly causing the death of the victim.
